video.title: Redux Toolkit Tutorial – JavaScript State Management Library
video.description:
Learn how to use Redux Toolkit in this course for beginners. Redux Toolkit is from the Redux team and tt is intended to be the standard way to write Redux logic. So if you want to learn Redux to help with state management, this is the video for you.

💻 Code: https://github.com/john-smilga/redux-toolkit-tutorial

✏️ Course developed by John Smilga. Check out his YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCMZFwxv5l-XtKi693qMJptA

⭐️ Course Conetents ⭐️
⌨️ (0:00:00) Setup Store
⌨️ (0:11:09) Create Slice
⌨️ (0:18:49) Dev Tools
⌨️ (0:20:28) useSelector()
⌨️ (0:29:04) Hero Icons
⌨️ (0:32:08) Local Data
⌨️ (0:34:24) Render List
⌨️ (0:43:33) Cart Item
⌨️ (0:46:59) Clear Cart
⌨️ (0:54:37) Return State
⌨️ (0:57:23) Remove Item
⌨️ (1:04:01) Toggle Amount
⌨️ (1:10:19) Calculate Totals
⌨️ (1:16:27) Create Modal
⌨️ (1:18:56) Modal Complete
⌨️ (1:28:26) createAsyncThunk
⌨️ (1:41:30) createAsyncThunk Options

🎉 Thanks to our Champion and Sponsor supporters:
👾 Raymond Odero
👾 Agustín Kussrow
👾 aldo ferretti
👾 Otis Morgan
👾 DeezMaster

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

topLevelComment.author: D B
topLevelComment.text:
Wonderful tutorial John! Definitely going to buy some of your courses on Udemy. You don't over-complicate things which I love for "learning".

I come from a senor PHP & JavaScript background trying to get into React/Node and people seem to over-complicate everything, using so many dependencies that it's almost impossible to grasp your head around. How do people not understand this? IMO it's more importantly to learn the barebone and how the core-functionalities work, rather than dumping your head with fancy dependencies or methods to do a certain function.

Anyways, great tutorial and can't wait to learn more of the MERN stack and perhaps look into other React full-stacks.

topLevelComment.author: Kayhan Kaya
topLevelComment.text: I have one question, why is the payload equal to cart id while defining the removeItem? I could not figure this out :/

replies.author: The Dev Guild
replies.text: Good question! I was also wondering how it work

replies.author: Marcin Kądziela
replies.text: Because in "CartItem.js", where you using removeItem, there is removeItem(id), so id is your payload. But for 'increase' there is: increase({id}), your payload is {id}, so id is inside payload obj.

topLevelComment.author: anas elmakhloufi
topLevelComment.text: what is differnce between redux & redux toolkit?

topLevelComment.author: xəyal isaxanov
topLevelComment.text: rtk with rtk-query VS apollo graphql, which one is better and why?

replies.author: Advaiya Lad
replies.text: Apollo is for graphql (when your API is a graphql API) and allows you to easily query your data (but only meant for graphql). Redux, on the other hand, is a multi-purpose app-wide state management library - which could be used to store API responses, but could be used to store other things as well. Redux toolkit is a toolkit to get started with redux easily. rtk-query allows you to query and cache API responses, but does not care whether your API is REST, GraphQL, RPC, or anything else.

topLevelComment.author: Raymond Caddick
topLevelComment.text: Awesome! Been looking for a dedicated course on this. Can anyone tell me if it's a requirement to know redux without redux toolkit or do most code bases use redux toolkit?

replies.author: Talha Aydın
replies.text: if you're learning for yourself, learn the latest and most recommended like redux toolkit. but if you're working at somewhere, just learn project-based. at any given time, a company project will be behind latest on npm packages.

replies.author: Johannes
replies.text: I only learned the theory of "normal" redux, and directly started with redux toolkit in my codebase. It provides structure for your project, and it's overall superior.
